CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 22, 1947, pg. 2, reads: "Did She 'Frame' Lover After Killing Hubby? - Homicide Lieut. Peter Connors, shown questioning witnesses and suspects in the Beamon Elps murder case Thursday as he took a statement from Wilkie Rhett, far left, who said he had been sitting at Mrs. Ethel Elps' (third from left) dinner table when she shot and killed her husband, Beamon. Lieutenant Connors said Mrs. Elps had run from her home at 226 Jones Avenue after shooting her husband, and immediately made a date with Clive Mason, second from left, who, not knowing of the murder, took Mrs. Elps to Wheeling, where she told Pittsburgh police that Mason killed her husband because of jealousy. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Homicide Lieutenant Peter Connors questioning Clive Mason, suspect Ethel Elps, and Wilkie Rhett for murder of Beamon Elps, with another man at typewriter, in police station
